result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Kone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed.   Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with the victim without her consent and consent of probation agent.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christopher J Kone in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 2. Court questions defendant on change of plea. After discussion with defendant, Court doesn't feel defendant is entering his pleas freely and voluntarily, trial will remain on the calendar for next week. Back on the record 10:50 am. Appearances still the same. Atty Reetz indicates some of the confusion defendant had during the plea colique. Defendant wishes to proceed with the plea today.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. Court dismisses Cts. 3 & 4 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. Court orders PSI. Bond remains in effect. Sentencing 5/16/16 at 3:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher J Kone in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Court makes statement, denies defendants motion to dismiss Ct. 2.  Matter will proceed to trial on 2/24/16. Bond remains in effect.
Defendant's reply to State's response to motion to dismiss and response to State's motion in limine
State's response to defense motion to dismiss and motion to prohibit evidence of consent of victim regarding strangulation pursuant to 904.01 and .02 Wis. Stats.
Defendant's Proposed

Defendant Christopher J Kone in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews in events in file, indicates matter is in the #1 position for trial. Court addresses Atty Reetz's motion to dismiss Ct. 2. Atty Reetz makes statement on motion. State responds, feels motion should be denied.  Court will let give State the opportunity to research case law regarding consent and provide that information to the court. Court will then make a decision on the motion by early next week. Discussion regarding 1 vs 2 day trial. State has 9 witnesses, feels it could go into a second day. Atty Reetz feels matter may resolve if Ct. 2 is dismissed. Court indicates matter may have to be rescheduled if 2 days needed for trial. Court will wait for info from State before deciding on motion, will then see if matter needs to be rescheduled or not. Bond remains in effect.
Ct. 2 by Defense

Pre-trial conference at 02-08-2016 08:30 am

Counsel request that trial not be set before Jan. 1, 2016 and that the court set aside 2 days for trial. Bond remains in effect.
